> I'm not familiar with the api you're using there. Multipart entity 
> doesn't sound like the right thing though.
I am using Apache's HTTPComponents 4.0.1. The Multipart thing was just a
shot in the dark but the effect was the same as with the StringEntity.

> But are you saying that the cxml you get back from heritrix is different 
> from the one you send it? E.g. here -
> 
> curl -T a.cxml [...] 
> https://localhost:8443/engine/job/myjob/jobdir/crawler-beans.cxml
> curl -o b.cxml [...] 
> https://localhost:8443/engine/job/myjob/jobdir/crawler-beans.cxml
> md5sum a.cxml b.cxml
> 
> ... the two md5s differ? If that's the case, it seems like that would 
> have to be a bug in restlet or maybe an encoding issue...
Yes, they do differ! If I PUT the file the file on Heritrix' side is
missing all new lines. This would not be that bad, since it is XML but
the seeds cannot be read anymore. They are only one long string without
even a space character. So splitting the seeds is practically impossible.

I have also been thinking about the encoding issue. At least
"Content-Type: application/xml" does not help at all. And if I add a
german umlaut into the config it is transfered correctly, i.e. I can
read it in the Heritrix file.

Somehow I think this is related to Restlet but I am unsure...

Daniel
